channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Jerome Powell says the Fed can afford to ‘wait and see’ before cutting rates. Other economists aren’t so sure
item.description: A data-dependent approach might leave the central bank playing catch-up.

item.title: Overnight Clashes Strain Diplomacy Efforts for India and Pakistan
item.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio emphasized the need for “immediate de-escalation” as he spoke with leaders from both countries.

item.title: U.S. Government to Stop Tracking the Costs of Extreme Weather
item.description: It would be harder for insurers and scientists to study wildfires, storms and other “billion dollar disasters,” which are growing more frequent as the...

item.title: Exclusive: Meta in talks to deploy stablecoins three years after giving up on landmark crypto project
item.description: The social media giant is exploring how to use stablecoins to pay content creators, among other uses, according to sources familiar with the matter.

item.title: Workforce AI skills are advancing slowly as the technology zooms ahead. Something has to give
item.description: The problem is likely to intensify as companies try applying AI tools to more complex parts of their business.

item.title: Trump calls Fed Chairman Powell a ‘fool’ but despite relentless attacks, he may be keeping him around for one key reason
item.description: Trump previously said he could remove Powell “real fast,” but has since backed down.

item.title: Bill Gates Accuses Elon Musk of ‘Killing Children’ by Cutting Foreign Aid
item.description: The Microsoft co-founder and philanthropist condemned his fellow billionaire for overseeing deep cuts to the U.S. Agency for International Development...

item.title: Leader of FEMA Is Dismissed as Trump Administration Takes Aim at the Agency

item.title: Bitcoin reclaims $100,000 as Trump announces trade deal with the UK
item.description: Bitcoin gained 5% after Trump announced he would roll back some tariffs on the U.K.

item.title: Pope Leo XIV, the First American Pontiff, Took A Global Route to the Top Post
item.description: Robert Francis Prevost, who led the Vatican office that selects and manages bishops globally, has spent much of his life outside the United States.
